original: Frisk, Jöns Ivan Hjalmar, fil. dr, professor, Göteborg, f. 4/8/Ö0 i Gbg av distr :förest. Nils F. o. Sara Christiansson. G. 28 m. Anita Bendz. Barn: Per Olof f. 29, Jan 31. — Stud:ex. v. Gbgs ilatin 18-, fil. kand. i Gbg 21, fil. lic. 24, fill. dr 27. Res. t. Heidelberg o. London 23, Paris 25, Rom 27, Berlin 28 o. 30. Vik. adj. v. Gbgs latin 25, vik. lektor där 26, timlär. v. Gbgs samsk. 23-26, ord. lär. i latin o. grek. 27-35, doc. i grek. spr. o. litt. v. Gbgs högsk. 27, dito i jämför, språkforskn. m. sanskrit 35, tf. prof. 37-38, prof. i jämför, språkforskn. m. sanskrit v. Gbgs högsk. sed. 38. Sekr. i Filolog, samf. i Gbg 31-36, LVVS 41, LVSL 44, medl. av Indogerm. Geselllsch. Skr.: Le Périple de ila mer Erythrée (grad:avh. 27), Papyrus grecs de la Bibi. munic. de Gothemb. (29), Bankakten aus dem Fayüm (31), Stud. zur grfiech. WoTtisiteiHunig (33), Zu indoiinan. u. griech. Nominalbiild. (34), »Wahrheit» und »Lüge» in d. indogerm. Sprachen (3(5), Suffix. th im Indogerm. (36), In-dogermanica (38), über d. Gebrauch des Privativpräfixes im .indogerm. Adj. (41), Etyma Armeniaca (44), redig. Meijerbergs Arkiv f. sv. ordforskn. •sed. 39. RNO.
translated: Frisk, Jöns Ivan Hjalmar, Ph.D., professor, Gothenburg, born August 4th, 19XX in Gothenburg to district supervisor Nils F. and Sara Christiansson. Married to Anita Bendz since 1928, with two children: Per Olof (born 1929) and Jan (born 1931). Frisk passed his studentexamen at Gothenburg Latin School in 1918, completed a Bachelor of Arts at Gothenburg University in 1921, a licentiate degree in 1924, and a doctorate degree in 1927. He traveled to Heidelberg and London in 1923, Paris in 1925, Rome in 1927, Berlin in 1928 and 1930. Frisk was an assistant teacher at Gothenburg Latin School in 1925, temporary lecturer in 1926, instructor at Gothenburg Samskola from 1923-1926, regular teacher in Latin and Greek from 1927-1935, assistant professor of Greek language and literature at Gothenburg University in 1927, and an associate professor of comparative linguistics with Sanskrit in 1935. He served as acting professor in 1937-1938, and as a full professor of comparative linguistics with Sanskrit at Gothenburg University since 1938. From 1931-1936, Frisk was secretary of the Philology Society in Gothenburg, member of the Royal Society of Sciences and Letters in Gothenburg in 1941 and of the Society of the Study of the Languages of Scandinavia in 1944, as well as a member of the Indogermanic Society. Frisk's published works include Le Périple de ila mer Erythrée (thesis, 1927), Papyrus grecs de la Bibi. municip. de Gothemb. (1929), Bankakten aus dem Fayüm (1931), Stud. zur grfiech. WoTtisiteiHunig (1933), Zu indoiinan. u. griech. Nominalbiild. (1934), "Wahrheit" und "Lüge" in d. indogerm. Sprachen (1935), Suffix. th im Indogerm. (1936), Indogermanica (1938), Über d. Gebrauch des Privativpräfixes im indogerm. Adj. (1941), Etyma Armeniaca (1944). Frisk also edited Meijerberg's Arkiv f. sv. ordforskn. since 1939. He was awarded the Swedish Order of the North Star.
